Module
mvau_tb_v2.​sv (testbench)

Author(s): Syed Asad Alam syed.as[xxx]ad.alam@tcd[xxx].ie

v2.0: This file lists a test bench for the matrix-vector activation batch unit.  The input and weights are read from a file generated by HLS. The output from DUT is matched against data generated from HLS.

It is part of the Xilinx FINN open source framework for implementing quantized neural networks on FPGAs

This material is based upon work supported, in part, by Science Foundation Ireland, www.sfi.ie under Grant No. 13/RC/2094 and, in part, by the European Union's Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme under the Marie Sklodowska-Curie grant agreement Grant No.754489.

Parameters
CLK_PER

Clock cycle period

INIT_DLY=(CLK_PER*2)+1

Initial delay

RAND_DLY=21

Random delay to be used when needed

NO_IN_VEC = 100

Number of input vectors

ACT_MatrixW = OFMDim*OFMDim;

Input activation matrix height

ACT_MatrixH = (KDim*KDim*IFMCh)

Input activation matrix weight

TOTAL_OUTPUTS = MatrixH*ACT_MatrixW

Total number of elements in the output matrix

Signals
rst_n

Asynchronous active low reset

out_v

Output valid signal

out

Output from DUT

out_packed

Output signal from DUT where each element is divided into multiple elements as DUT produces a packed output of size PE x TDstI Dimension: PE, word length: TDstI

in_v

Input valid

in_mat

Input activation matrix Dimension: ACT_MatrixH x ACT_MatrixW, word length: TSrcI

in

Input activation stream to DUT Dimension: SIMD, word length: TSrcI

mvau_beh

Output matrix holding output of behavioral simulation Dimension: MatrixH x ACT_MatrixW

test_count

An integer to count for successful output matching

Initial blocks
CLK_RST_GEN

Initialization of Clock and Reset and performing validation between output of DUT and behavioral model

Combinatorial Always Blocks
CLK_GEN

Generating clock using the CLK_PER as clock period

INP_MAT_GEN

Input matrix generation using random data

OUT_ACT_MAT_GEN

Always block for populating the output activation matrix from a memory file
